item.title: Effective Visualization of Multi-Dimension Image Data in Python
item.description: Multi-dimensional image data is, generally speaking, cumbersome to visualize. In scientific imaging (or in most imaging areas), multi-dimensional images are very common. The additional dimension could be anything from the physical 3rd dimension (“Z axis”), where 2D images are taken at different depths; to the time dimension, where 2D images are taken at different time intervals; to different channels in scientific imaging instruments such as atomic force microscopes or in RGB images.
